death.attack.blue.tr.wild.trap: %1$s was caught by a vine trap
death.attack.blue.tr.wild.trap.player: %1$s was caught by a vine trap while running from %2$s
death.attack.blue.tr.wild.trap.item: %1$s was caught by a vine trap while running from %2$s
blue.tr.menu.particles_hover: Swaps between Low, Medium, and High trim particles
blue.tr.menu.give_hover: Type the name of the templates you want after clicking this
blue.tr.menu.give_hover_warn: Only use this if they were somehow lost or its a test world
blue.tr.menu.toggles_hover: Expanded menu to toggle trim usage and objectives
blue.tr.menu.world_data_hover: Receive a compact message of information regarding Trims Overhaul
blue.tr.command_feedback: If you don't care about seeing other operators running commands in chat, it's recommended to disable the %s gamerule to improve the menus
blue.tr.no_equipped_trim: You don't have a trim equipped
blue.tr.not_trim_owner: You aren't the owner of this trim
blue.tr.import_restore: Click this message to restore the previous settings
blue.tr.test_world_guide: to change trims and give yourself items
blue.tr.test_world_warn: Also ask yourself: "Is this world important?" before using this. If the answer is yes, run this function again.
blue.tr.returned: template(s) have been returned to you
blue.tr.adv_root.desc_1: Direct any bugs or suggestions to ActuallyBlue on the Discord server, clickable link in the
blue.tr.adv.bolt.desc: Builders who learn to guide copper and currents alike can shape the world to be their own
blue.tr.adv.coast.desc: Shipwrecks and ocean ruins hide more than treasure, they boost what you can pull from the sea
blue.tr.adv.custom_materials.title: Custom Materials
blue.tr.adv.custom_materials.desc: Combine them with their corresponding trim to greatly empower its abilities
blue.tr.adv.dune.desc: Deserts burn strength into those who endure their storms and shifting ground
blue.tr.adv.eye.desc: Even sight cannot be trusted, for as what can be seen is not real; it's merely a show
blue.tr.adv.flow.desc: The ground seems distant when you're trained at staying off through mastery over wind
blue.tr.adv.menu.desc: Opens the main menu, where you can then view server settings, transfer trims, view all trim owners, and more.
blue.tr.adv.objectives.title: Objectives
blue.tr.adv.objectives.desc: Be the first one to find the templates and complete its objective before anyone else to obtain usable templates alongside ownership over it.
blue.tr.adv.mats.title: Trim Materials
blue.tr.adv.mats.desc: Every material has a unique effect as mentioned here. Vanilla increases attributes while custom ones empower a specific trim.
blue.tr.adv.owner.title: Ownership
blue.tr.adv.owner.desc: The first one to complete an objective becomes the owner of said trim, with only them being able to hold the templates or use its powers, but it can be transferred.
blue.tr.adv.combat.title: Combat Timer
blue.tr.adv.combat.desc: Taking damage from enemies will put you in combat, which will either enable or restrict the use of certain abilities, depending on the situation.
blue.tr.adv.keep_inv.title: Keep Inventory
blue.tr.adv.keep_inv.desc: Dropped trims will teleport back into your inventory whenever you respawn. If you were killed by a player, then they'll instead receive one trim from your inventory, alongside ownership over them.
blue.tr.adv.protection.title: Template Protection
blue.tr.adv.protection.desc: Multiple systems are in place to make trims nearly impossible to lose (since only 4 templates exist without commands), such as item immortality and low-durability trim removal. However, none of them can interfere with crafting menus or vanishing curse, so be careful.
blue.tr.adv.q1.title: Objective Not Working
blue.tr.adv.q1.desc: If you're positive you're doing it correctly, then the objective has either already been completed, or the server has changed it to another type.
blue.tr.adv.q2.title: Finding Trim Owner
blue.tr.adv.q2.desc: Wearing a trim you don't own will create a faint particle in the direction of its owner if they're online.
blue.tr.adv.q3.title: Custom Materials Not Working
blue.tr.adv.q3.desc: They only buff their single corresponding trim. You'll get a message whenever you get the right combination.
blue.tr.adv.q4.title: Do Materials Work?
blue.tr.adv.q4.desc: Yes, just most bonuses are barely noticeable.
blue.tr.adv.q5.title: Trim Doesn't Work
blue.tr.adv.q5.desc: Make sure you're wearing the full set with it enabled as its owner. Check both in the main menu
blue.tr.adv.host.desc: Protection is about more than shields, but the joined effort of keeping your entire group alive
blue.tr.adv.vanilla_materials.title: Vanilla Materials
blue.tr.adv.raiser.desc: Mastery of experience is proven not by books, but by the foes you continue to burn down with them
blue.tr.adv.rib.desc: Ash and bone remember fire, charged flames upheld, strikes spreading the Wither's influence
blue.tr.adv.sentry.desc: Enduring countless raids can sharpen your aim and your defense, making it easier than ever before
blue.tr.adv.shaper.desc: The survival of countless explosions tends to be redirected to the power of true demolition
blue.tr.adv.silence.desc: Surpassing the Wardens granted you their secrets, inflicting the fear you conquered to those around
blue.tr.adv.snout.desc: Those who've seen every possible outcome know just how unpredictable the exchange can be
blue.tr.adv.spire.desc: Endless skies lift the chosen upward, their natural guidance surpassing even the Dragon's
blue.tr.adv.tide.desc: Conquering the oceans brings forth its tidal mastery, empowering itself in any similar territory
blue.tr.adv.trim_sets.title: Trimmed Sets
blue.tr.adv.trim_sets.desc: Wearing the full set of a trim will grant multiple unique passives and abilities (if owned)
blue.tr.adv.root.desc: Give each trim unique powers while making them only obtainable via quests
blue.tr.adv.vex.desc: Enemies caught away from allies quickly realize how punishing their disadvantage can be
blue.tr.adv.ward.desc: Blocking strike after strike eventually becomes second nature, turning defense into offense
blue.tr.adv.wayfinder.desc: Exploring structure after structure sharpens your sense of direction, making paths feel shorter than they are
blue.tr.adv.wild.desc: Taming the world reveals more than loyalty; it brings new strength to the nature around you
blue.tr.tutorial.completion: You've completed your first objective! Now you're the owner of this trim, and nobody else can use or obtain it.
blue.tr.tutorial.completion_extra: - Here are some mini hover-guides to help out:
blue.tr.tutorial.template_hover:
The 4 glowing templates you got are the only to exist, so don't lose them
You can un-trim your armor by placing a Smithing Table on top of another, and there are plenty of systems to prevent permanently losing templates - except through crafting.
blue.tr.tutorial.ownership_hover:
The only way you lose your ownership or someone else gains it is:
1) You transfer it to someone else via the [Transfer] menu
2) A player kills you and steals your ownership, based on settings
3) It's manually revoked by a server administrator

There's also a menu to view all trim owners, click for a shortcut.
blue.tr.tutorial.materials_hover:
Every trim 'synergizes' with a single, specific material, but it isn't required to use them so customize your armor however you want.
Vanilla materials add another to the 'stack' as if you had 6 pieces on in total
Custom materials will empower the trim, granting it more abilities

Press
blue.tr.tutorial.materials_hover_4: to open the advancements page, where you can view all materials.
blue.tr.tutorial.settings_hover_1: Some trims can have their abilities customized by the server, so you should make sure the ability you're about to rely on wasn't changed.
blue.tr.tutorial.settings_hover_2: Click here for a shortcut to the [Trim Settings] page
blue.tr.no_delete_confirmation: You don't have deletion confirmation, please run the remove_trims_overhaul debug function first.
blue.tr.open_resource_pack: Opens the official Resource Pack page
blue.tr.resource_pack_info:
Semi-optional. Needed for armor using custom materials,
and fixes menu spacing. Also adds language support
blue.beg_for_followers:
If you've enjoyed this project, then
 please consider following on Modrinth
blue.tr.placement_description: Throw copper blocks to temporarily place and conduct between you and them. Only one can exist at a time. Players in the path are zapped; making them spin with Nausea, while you gain Speed.
blue.tr.builder_description_1:
Various permanent buffs, mainly for building
               -  +70%% Block Reach
               -  +60%% Step Height
blue.tr.builder_hover: Normally 15/16th of a block, so you can't step up full blocks unless you're on something like carpet.
blue.tr.overcharge_description: Getting struck by lightning 'Overcharges' you, giving you long Speed, Glowing, Haste, and you periodically zap nearby players throughout it.
blue.tr.pirate_description: Gain extra luck while in a shipwreck.
blue.tr.geyser_description: Sand landing on recently placed sand creates a geyser that burns enemies and heals allies.
blue.tr.archeologist_description: Gain Luck while brushing any block.
blue.tr.endurance_description: Periodic Fire Resistance and permanent Attack Damage while in sandy biomes. Doubled if in a Desert Temple.
blue.tr.novelty_description: Water bottles act like weak Golden Apples, restoring hunger and health.
blue.tr.stalk_description: Mark players visible through a Spyglass. Each player builds a charge, where you can release when it's full to 'Scare' them all, dealing medium damage with debuffs and a loud noise.
blue.tr.alarm_description: Alerts you when players enter or leave your Stronghold. You gain Speed and Invisibility while in it.
blue.tr.alarm_hover: Selects the first Stronghold you enter with Eye equipped, and it cannot be moved. Holding an Eye of Ender will trace the Stronghold.
blue.tr.not_unlocked: You haven't unlocked this message yet.
blue.tr.ghostly_stalk_description: Stalk slows marked players, and 'Scare' applies a significant amount of %s.
blue.tr.haunted_alarm_description: Players in your Stronghold suffer permanent Slowness, Glowing, and low %s.
blue.tr.presence_description: Nearby glowing player receive low %s, regardless of source.
blue.tr.gravity_description: Permanent reduced Gravity. Reduced further in Trial Chambers.
blue.tr.graceful_description: Increased Safe-Fall Distance and Attack Knockback, with reduced Fall Damage.
blue.tr.air_flow_description: Permanent Wind Charged, with brief Water Breathing upon entering water.
blue.tr.wind_barrage_description: Dropping 60+ Wind Charges at once while high in the air will start 'Wind Barrage', causing you to float upwards before rapidly blasting a hundred empowered Wind Charges where you're looking over a few seconds.
blue.tr.wind_barrier_description: Deflect nearby projectiles, and absorb thrown Wind Charges. Empower your own thrown Wind Charges if high in the air.
blue.tr.gust_description: The first Wind Charge you throw while high in the air will empower it even further and propel yourself in the opposite direction. Refreshes when landing or using Wind Burst.
blue.tr.true_gravity_description: Gravity is reduced further when looking up, but increased when looking down and sneaking.
blue.tr.morale_description: Nearby Villagers gain strong buffs, players get 40%% Resistance. Gain Resistance equal to what you grant.
blue.tr.sacrifice_description: Take true damage based on damage to allies.
blue.tr.exchange_description: Hold sneak to swap places with an ally, even through blocks. Both gain Invisibility and Regeneration. If they're low, double the speed and sacrifice health if possible.
blue.tr.proficiency_description: Gain permanent Movement Speed, Attack Speed, and Attack Damage based on your experience level.
blue.tr.proficiency_hover: Does nothing below level 20, and limited to level 100 if Keep Inventory is enabled, otherwise 150. Can be uncapped via server settings.
blue.tr.piercer_description: Hold sneak with nothing in your hand after being hit recently to shoot out a Resistance-piercing beam. Rapidly drains experience, but halved when in Old Growth biomes.
blue.tr.conversion_description: Hold an Experience Bottle to instead spray harmless orbs, not equal to drained experience.
blue.tr.magnetic_description: Experience orbs move towards you from twice the normal distance.
blue.tr.wither_skull_description: %s + %s to shoot out a simple Wither Skull.
blue.tr.cursed_deflect_description: Reflected fireballs fly twice as fast and hit three times harder.
blue.tr.cursed_deflect_hover: This doesn't give a way to spawn fireballs. Intended to be used with Ghasts, like the quest.
blue.tr.decapitation_description: Wither Skeletons have an increased chance to drop skulls.
blue.tr.infliction_description: Hitting non-burning players has a chance to make your next hit apply strong, short wither.
blue.tr.flaming_aegis_description: At low health, burn all nearby projectiles (except Tridents and your own) while periodically scorching nearby enemies.
blue.tr.innate_heat_description: Wither Skull and Cursed Deflect leave a long trail of mild damage.
blue.tr.nether_regulation_description: You and your vehicle gain permanent Wither immunity and Fire Resistance.
blue.tr.ballista_hover:
It needs to be fully charged to empower the shot.
Higher effect levels don't change the charge speed or sounds.
blue.tr.sharpshooter_description: Plain arrows deal more damage, doubled if inside a village.
blue.tr.defender_description: Gain buffs based on nearby Raiders. One will always be targeted, and killing them will improve the buffs and drop bonus Emeralds based on luck.
blue.tr.defender_hover: Killing the targeted Raider will give the same ambient effects except longer and higher level, but the level reduces over time, meaning you can "chain" kills easier.
blue.tr.controlled_demolition_descriptio: Drop TNT onto the ground to immediately place it, fuse scaling on server difficulty.
blue.tr.explosive_expert_description: Take significantly reduced damage from most explosions based on server difficulty. Completely negated when in Old Growth biomes.
blue.tr.undermine_description: Breaking weak blocks while sneaking also breaks the block below it. This can apply to nearby players.
blue.tr.undermine_hover:
Dirt, Gravel, Stone, Cobblestone, Andesite,
Granite, Diorite, and Non-Deepslate Ores.
blue.tr.not-so_controlled_demolition_des: Dropping TNT will immediately launch it forwards. Short cooldown, with the explosion strength, speed, and fuse scaling on server difficulty.
blue.tr.explosive_master_description: Gain a few more effects when taking explosion damage, on top of the damage reduction.
blue.tr.darkness_description: Nearby players will be inflicted with Darkness. If they're in the Deep Dark, apply %s as well.
blue.tr.muffle_description: When a player is muffled, most of their sounds immediately end with constant background noise.
blue.tr.sculk_ally_description: Wardens will not target you unless you have attacked them at least once, where then they'll be extra angry.
blue.tr.vortex_description: Dropping half a stack of Echo Shards at once will temporarily reduce your armor to launch a sonic sphere forwards. When it touches a block, it'll pull every nearby mob closer as it charges up, before unleashing a catastrophic burst of damage based on distance and applying long %s to all nearby players.
blue.tr.harvester_description: Killing a mob near a Sculk Catalyst gives bonus Echo Shards based on luck.
blue.tr.gamble_description: Dropping gold will begin offering it to the Piglin Gods, giving a very random effect or ability. The more gold that's in the item stack, the more likely it'll be positive.
blue.tr.gamble_hover_1: The dice visual represents the effect type
blue.tr.gold_lord_description: Reduce how indecisive Piglins are, making them trade faster based on how much gold you're wearing.
blue.tr.piglin_description: Permanent high Haste with all golden tools, and Fire Resistance in bastions.
blue.tr.guidance_hover:
Gives the Slow Falling from Weightless Field
Lower cooldown while in the End.
blue.tr.high_jump_description: Permanent high Jump Boost, increased in the End.
blue.tr.weightless_field_description: Nearby mobs lose gravity. Holding sneak gives you Slow Falling.
blue.tr.origin_description: While in the End, gain extra Armor and Attack Damage, with immunity to Endermen. Reach the End by surpassing the overworld's height.
blue.tr.void_aperture_description: Falling into the End's void opens a temporary portal that anything can follow through. Only you gain fall immunity until landing.
blue.tr.void_plunge_hover:
Damage activates at 75/100%% charge (3/4 rings)
25/50%% charge instead reduces the cooldown by half.
'Guidance' can be used immediately after using 'Void Plunge'.
blue.tr.blastobreath_description: Dragon breath becomes throwable, creating a damage pool where it lands. Only one at a time.
blue.tr.aquatic_description: Gain effects based on if you're in rain, water, and/or oceans.
blue.tr.conduit_description: Holding a Conduit will give you and nearby players its effect.
blue.tr.technique_description: Melee hits with Tridents deal additional damage.
blue.tr.long_thorns_description: Deal a small amount of damage to ranged attackers. Deals double damage in Ocean Monuments.
blue.tr.reservoir_description: Build up 'Tidal Stacks' based on how much you use Aquatic or drink Water Bottles. Being in a Ocean Monument increases the recharge speed way more than the others.
blue.tr.tidal_burst_description: while holding a Trident to unleash a burst of damage that goes through hit-immunity. Costs 1 'Tidal Stack' and is stronger in water.
blue.tr.triple_strike:
('Triple-Strike')
Killing a target extends the initial bonus
blue.tr.kinetic_deflection_description: Store damage blocked with a shield. Upon release, spawn a large supportive field if you're looking down, otherwise spawn a fast, heavy-knockback barrier.
blue.tr.warded_defense_description: Extra armor toughness in the Deep Dark.
blue.tr.last_resort_description: Taking heavy damage knocks everything back, then deals an aftershock of damage at the cost of armor durability, but heals you.
blue.tr.stonewall_description: Extra Armor and Knockback Resistance(s) while sneaking with a shield.
blue.tr.grapple_description: Fishing Rods pull you towards it upon block collision, at the cost of most of its durability.
blue.tr.nimble_description: to give yourself temporary Slow Falling.
blue.tr.true_wayfinder_description: ⓜ Throughout your travels, you've learned your trim synergizes with Nether Stars.
blue.tr.warp_description: Holding a lodestone-bound compass in your offhand (while standing still, without being hit recently) will charge up a teleport, eventually warping to said lodestone and breaking the compass.
blue.tr.locator_description: Standing on path-like blocks OR holding a map, while sneaking, will locate the nearest player, with a faint particle trail.
blue.tr.locator_hover:
By default, has a maximum range of 240 blocks.
Can be configured by the server to make it infinite or completely disable it.
blue.tr.explorer_2_description: Increased maximum Speed from continuously sprinting.
blue.tr.spectral_warp_description: Recovery Compasses can now be used with Warp. Teleports slower, but leads to your last death. Still breaks the compass.
blue.tr.paired_locator_description: 'Locator' will now track the player closest to the first player.
blue.tr.explorer_3_description: Increased base sprinting Speed, and maximum Speed from continuously sprinting. Your food can no longer go below a certain amount.
blue.tr.trailblazer_description: Sprinting for long enough will increase your Speed a significant amount, leaving a trail that gives other players a lower amount of Speed.
blue.tr.safe_return_description: Falling into the Overworld's void will teleport you back to the surface.
blue.tr.florist_description: %s + %s with any small flower to consume it, giving its suspicious stew effect and saturation.
blue.tr.zoologist_description: Gain debuff immunities and positive effects based on the amount of tamed animals nearby. Add 3 to this counter when in a Jungle.
blue.tr.natures_war_description: Nearby TNT thrown by Shaper will be snatched out of the air and disassembled.
blue.tr.grounded_description: Standing on dirt or grass without short grass will rarely make it grow more, giving you Haste and Saturation.
blue.tr.creative.settings:
If you're an operator, you can click on any of the text above to cycle between its options, with more buttons in the first menu, assuming you stay in Creative mode.

Creative players also bypass some settings (amongst plenty of other things), with the most notable ones being 'Manual Transfer' and 'Template Clearing'
blue.tr.skip_tutorials: Woah.. you've skipped all the tutorials!
blue.tr.tutorials.skip_hover:
If that's cause you've played before, then thanks for staying.
(And if not, well, then thanks for using my pack in the first place)
blue.tr.no_transfer_target: Failed to find a player in front of you
blue.tr.tutorial.transfer_hover:
The target needs to be within 6 blocks and not completely invisible

If you're having trouble with the direct armor method, try using templates.
You can untrim your armor by placing a Smithing Table on top of another.
blue.tr.sm.negative_disable: Set to -1 to disable the usage of this ability.
blue.tr.sm.throw_hover: Cooldown for Shaper's throwable TNT  •  Default: 15 (0.75s)
blue.tr.sm.ward_auto_hover: The speed Ward's shield "takes" damage over time  •  Default: 6
blue.tr.sm.trap_hover: Maximum amount of Wild's 'Grass Traps'  •  Default: 6
blue.tr.sm.gamble_limit_hover: Maximum amount of 'Gamble' rolls at a time  •  Default: 4
blue.tr.sm.gamble_hover: Positive effect multiplier for Snout's 'Gamble'  •  Default: 15 (1.5x)
blue.tr.tutorial.creative: Hey %s, If this is your first time managing a Trims Overhaul server, hover this message for some info.
blue.tr.tutorial.creative_hover:
If you're an operator, you can give yourself ownership and templates by running %s - ideally only for testing

As an operator, you can click on the setting names (inside the settings menu) to change them, or run %s as a shortcut.

You also get more buttons in the menus while in creative

If you want more help, click here to join the Discord.
blue.tr.tutorial.new_player: Psst, hover me if you're new to Trims Overhaul
blue.tr.tutorial.new_player_note: (Almost all of this can be customized)
blue.tr.no_stronghold: You need to enter a Stronghold to select it (Cannot be undone)
blue.tr.tutorial.drop_hover:
If that doesn't work, search how to drop multiple items at once online
Or, open your inventory, drag it out, then click.
blue.tr.tutorial.piercer_hover: 'Combat' is just an invisible timer that means you've been hit by something recently.
blue.tr.tutorial.piercer_level: you are high enough level (20+) to use 'Piercer'
blue.tr.spire_throw_cd: You can only throw one at a time
blue.tr.spire_disabled: Spire's ability to teleport to the End is disabled
blue.tr.important_compass: This compass appears to be important to another datapack.
blue.tr.stolen_hover_1: Dying to a player will transfer trims to them, based on the 'Death Transfer' setting.
blue.tr.stolen_hover_2: Click here for a shortcut to the main menu
blue.tr.tutorial.death_singular: A player got you to low health! Dying to them will transfer ownership over one of the trims in your inventory
blue.tr.tutorial.death_hover: The amount can be seen and/or customized in the [Settings] menu.
blue.tr.tutorial.death_plural: A player got you to low health! Dying to them will transfer ownership over multiple trims in your inventory
blue.tr.tutorial.resources: If you haven't already and you want to fix armor using custom materials, a few death messages, and some weird spacing; then download the resource pack
blue.tr.tutorial.here_hover:
Opens the official resource pack page
The latest version should work regardless.
blue.tr.tutorial.copy_hover: Copies the website link to your clipboard.
blue.tr.tutorial.pickup_1: Templates will be cleared from your inventory upon picking them up, as they're instead used to unlock its corresponding,
blue.tr.tutorial.pickup_3: which you need to complete before anyone else to obtain permanent ones, alongside its powers.
blue.tr.tutorial.pickup_hover:
The template clearing and requirement can both be configured on the server.
If you don't want objectives to be secretive, you can check out the official wiki in the [Links] menu.
blue.tr.ask_transfer: What trim do you want to transfer?
blue.tr.transfer_failed: Something went wrong with your transfer. Confirm you own the trim you're attempting to transfer and that you selected the right one with the right items.
blue.tr.info_shortcut: Click here for a shortcut to the info menu
blue.tr.tutorial.transfer_1: This menu can be used to transfer the ownership of any of your trims to the nearest player. You must have the 4 templates anywhere in your inventory
blue.tr.tutorial.transfer_3: the full set equipped while the target has an untrimmed set on.
blue.tr.tutorial.transfer_4: ⚠ You cannot undo this action by yourself ⚠
blue.tr.tutorial.transfer_warning: The only way you can get ownership back is by killing the new owner, or having the owner transfer it back. You can view the current owner in the [Owners] menu
blue.tr.tutorial.untrim: If you have any trimmed armor equipped, you can place a Smithing Table on top of another to instantly take all templates and materials off your armor, safely returning it directly to your inventory, with no cooldown.
blue.tr.tutorial.untrim_hover_1: In a normal server, only 4 templates exist at once, so it's highly recommended to use this if you ever want to change the trim on your armor
blue.tr.tutorial.untrim_hover_2: This will untrim armor even if you aren't the owner of the templates.
blue.tr.armor_return: A trimmed armor piece has returned to you
blue.tr.disable_message: Click here to disable this reload message
blue.tr.require_restart: Some datapacks use features that require a server restart
blue.tr.coast_quest_warn: - Only craft this when you know it'll complete the quest.
blue.tr.sm.aperture_info: Spire can still teleport to the Overworld, but nothing can follow it.
blue.tr.sm.gravity_hover: Spire removes gravity from nearby mobs (ON, Hostiles, OFF)
blue.tr.sm.origin_hover: Spire can go to the End by surpassing the Overworld's build limit (ON, OFF)
blue.tr.sm.ashen_hover: Rib can only get Ashen stacks while in the Nether (ON, OFF)
blue.tr.sm.scorch_hover: Rib's scorch effects require combat (ON, OFF)
blue.tr.sm.spawn_hover: Rib needs to be in combat to spawn mobs (ON, OFF)
blue.tr.sm.tracker_hover: Range of Wayfinder's Tracker (Limited, Infinite, OFF)
blue.tr.sm.return_hover: Max Wayfinder returns to the surface if in the Overworld's void (ON, OFF)
blue.tr.sm.vortex_hover: Silence's Vortex ability damages blocks (OFF, ON)
blue.tr.death_transfer_amount_hover: Amount of trims transferred between players on death (1, 2, 3, 4, All, Hardcore, 0)
blue.tr.hardcore_hover: No trims are transferred on death, BUT, the trim a player is wearing on any death will become completely REVOKED as if its objective was never completed. Bypasses keepInventory.
blue.tr.limit_owned_trims_hover: Limit the amount of trims a player can own to a specific amount (OFF, 1, 2, 3, 4)
blue.tr.manual_untrimming_hover: If players can un-trim their armor with Smithing Tables (ON, OFF)
blue.tr.objective_announcements_hover: Announce completed objectives to all online players (ON, OFF)
blue.tr.objective_type_hover: How players complete objectives (Quests, Tasks, Unlock, Impossible)
blue.tr.random_task_defender_hover: State of the RTD system. (ON, AUTO, OFF)
blue.tr.require_unlock_hover: If players need to pickup a template to unlock its objective (ON, OFF)
blue.tr.set_default: All settings have been reset to their defaults.
blue.tr.template_clearing_hover: Clear vanilla templates from player inventories (ON, Semi-ON, OFF)
blue.tr.template_semi_clearing: Templates are still cleared - unless you're the owner, then you can hold any template, essentially allowing restocking.
blue.tr.tutorial.rtd_1: Quickly input the number that has appeared on your screen into
blue.tr.tutorial.rtd_2: to gain progress for your current task. Failing to do so in time or correctly will instead take away progress.
blue.tr.tutorial.rtd_hover: RTD will randomly activate whenever you're progressing any task (not quests) in order to slow down AFK progression.
blue.tr.version_restraint: This feature can not work on <1.20.2
blue.tr.tutorial.new_player_hover:
Quick summary: Pickup templates to instead unlock objectives, and only by being the first to complete those objectives are you able to use those templates, and therefore its powers. %s

You can run %s to open the main menu, where you can find the server settings, Wiki link, view all owned trims (templates), and more.

If you have any questions, feel free to ask in the Discord anytime, which you can join by clicking this message.

The blue tab in the advancements page (Press %s) also has more information.
blue.tr.dune_quest: Crush them beneath the shifting sands
blue.tr.eye_quest: Cast your sight and step into the glow
blue.tr.flow_quest: Seven strikes aloft, then one that shakes the world
blue.tr.ward_quest: Defend against many in the deepest dark
blue.tr.sentry_quest: Win the Raid before the bell fades
blue.tr.vex_quest: Strike down the one who mimics the Vex
blue.tr.coast_quest: Forge the template of the sea's heart
blue.tr.wild_quest: Lead all of nature into its Lush Cave
blue.tr.snout_quest: Obtain every treasure that gold can grant
blue.tr.tide_quest: Slay the rarest of Drowneds, and the last Elder Guardian
blue.tr.spire_quest: Endure true End Crystal bursts, then claim the Dragon Egg
blue.tr.bolt_quest: Play the Creator's song beneath the night sky
blue.tr.silence_quest: Strike the Warden in its lair, then again on the surface
blue.tr.rib_quest: Burn the Wither with flames while wearing its crown
blue.tr.shaper_quest: Kill with TNT, then endure Charged wrath
blue.tr.host_quest: Gather a large population in close council
blue.tr.raiser_quest: Slay with the weakest of enchants
blue.tr.wayfinder_quest: Discover all the world has to offer
blue.tr.provide_material_hover:
In 1.21.5+, you need to have custom materials in your inventory upon opening the Smithing Table to use them
This changes their data so it won't stack with other normal items, but you can put it in your 2x2 crafting grid to remove only the new data.
blue.tr.delete_success:
You have disabled ActuallyBlue's %s datapack, and it has removed most of its data from your world.

 - Please confirm the datapack is disabled by confirming it doesn't appear in %s
 - If you wish to re-enable the datapack, just run: %s

   (the `trims...` is a placeholder. Fill in whatever looks correct)
blue.tr.menu.world_data_hover_note: Only contains relevant data, nothing sensitive
blue.tr.menu.export_hover: Exports all server settings - click the message that appears to copy it
blue.tr.unlocked_objectives_hover: Based on the server settings, you need to pick up the vanilla template to unlock objectives. This is the list of templates you've already picked up.
blue.tr.blacklist_hover: This list is managed by server operators, per player.
blue.too_long: - Use a command block if you can't run this in chat
blue.tr.sm.warp_type_hover: Valid positions for Wayfinder's Warp abilities (All, Bound, Death, OFF)
blue.tr.sm.guidance_range_hover: Distance / Speed of Spire's Guidance (Low, Medium, High)
blue.tr.sm.tnt_bounce_hover: Shaper's thrown TNT will bounce off blocks (ON, OFF)
blue.tr.wither_skull_hover: Cooldown is reduced inside Nether Fortresses.
blue.tr.explorer_hover: Speed increase charges up faster when in a non-vanilla dimension.
blue.tr.stalk_hover: Charge rapidly depletes when not looking at a player, especially when not in a Stronghold.
blue.tr.adv.wiki.title: Official Wiki
blue.tr.adv.wiki.desc: There is a public, up to date wiki available on GitHub, with a clickable link in the [Links] menu.
blue.tr.adv.trust.title: Trust System
blue.tr.adv.trust.desc: Using the [Trust] button in the main menu, you can toggle your trim's trust for individual players, preventing most ambient effects from affecting them.
blue.tr.menu.is_interactable: Text in this menu is interactable
blue.tr.unskip_tutorials: You have now un-skipped all the tutorials
blue.tr.gamble_hover_4:
⚄[5] and ⚅[6] are "high-tier" effects, which are twice as rare if the stack doesn't have at least a full stack of gold (or 7+ gold blocks)
Activates slightly faster when in any kind of bastion.
blue.tr.unlock_note: Click here to open the objective Wiki
blue.tr.sm.limit_plunge_hover: Spire's Void Plunge has a forced rotation (ON, OFF)
blue.tr.menu.logs_hover: View logs for objectives, unlocks, transfers, and installation
blue.tr.menu.logs_note: These are completely unused except for this one menu
blue.tr.logs.base:
Server Started %s minutes ago
 Datapack downloaded %s minutes ago
blue.tr.logs.empty: Nothing has been stored in this type of log yet
blue.tr.cheat_wayfinder: To give yourself max Wayfinder progression, you'll also need to run %s
blue.tr.adv.dragon_egg.desc: Counts towards any set, and grants one of its trim's environmental bonuses
blue.tr.charge_description: Break blocks faster the more copper you're using. Gain +2 stacks for this while in Trial Chambers
blue.tr.send_feedback: If you have spare time, please answer any of the questions on this anonymous form. This link will be permanent, so feel free to share it.
blue.tr.impact_blast_description: After a long fall, land with an explosion that negates fall damage and damages nearby enemies.
blue.tr.fire_description: Drop 1 of any kind of fish while not sneaking to shoot it out with unique effects based on the type.
blue.tr.spire_quest_reset: - You landed on End Stone and lost your Spire progress
blue.tr.flow_quest_reset: - You landed and lost your Flow progress
blue.tr.silence_quest_reset: - You died and lost your Silence progress
blue.tr.natures_gift_description: Tamed and ridden animals gain permanent buffs based on the type. If killed, their attacker takes damage with debuffs.
blue.tr.curist_hover: Increases the counter when in a village, which gets rid of the health reduction
blue.tr.curist_description: Gain up to 7 bonus hearts from curing Villagers, but they're only usable while near enough Villagers, Iron Golems, and / or true allies, each with a max amount. Instead lose a heart if none are nearby.
blue.tr.fisher_description: When fishing in sandy biomes or shipwrecks, gain additional loot rolls based on luck.
blue.tr.host_untrust: Hitting allied players enough times will remove Host's trust from all nearby players
blue.tr.sm.emeralds_hover: Scale for the bonus emeralds from Sentry's 'Defender'  •  Default: 100 (100%%)
blue.tr.sm.disfigure_hover: How long it takes Eye to use Disfigure; half as long against other's pearls  •  Default: 30 (2.5s)
blue.tr.sorted_trims: Click on any number to open the command to change it. All 3 values are described in the hover text to the right
blue.tr.objective_info_hover:
Decides who can progress each objective.
0 = Everybody / Incomplete
1 = Nobody / Completed
2 = Only Owner / Custom
blue.tr.usage_info_hover:
Toggles the usage of individual trims, but not their objective.
0 = Cannot be used
1 = Can be used
2 = Only base effects - no empowerment, if any.
blue.tr.sm.proficiency_multiplier_hover: The strength of each level with Raiser's 'Proficiency'  •  Default: 100 (100%%)
blue.tr.sm.placement_hover: How far Bolt can place blocks with 'Placement'  •  Default: 35 (3.5 blocks)
blue.tr.ability_shortcuts_hover: Additional ways to activate specific trim abilities (OFF, Command, Both, Drop)
blue.tr.shortcut_description:
Command: Use most sneak abilities via %s.
 Drop: Dropped weapons instantly return and trigger drop abilities (unless sneaking).
blue.tr.death_untrim_hover: Upon death, dropped armor is automatically untrimmed - meaning only templates are teleported (ON, OFF)
blue.tr.trim_locator_bar_hover: Players wearing one of their trims will have their waypoint texture match the corresponding template (OFF, ON)
blue.tr.reversal_description: While grounded, look up to charge reversed gravity. Leaving the ground launches nearby entities upward; sneaking instead slams them downward with greater range. Cancels if held too long.
blue.tr.void_plunge_description: Using Guidance shortly after Reversal will instead cause you to quickly dive forwards. If Reversal's charge was high enough, create a large burst and growing pool of magic damage upon landing.
blue.tr.mcmeta_note: Primarily used for armor with custom materials
blue.tr.joust_description: Using a spear while Trailblazer is active will reset it but grant a very strong but short burst of Speed
blue.tr.traversal_description: Upon changing dimensions, gain a short but strong burst of decaying Resistance.
blue.tr.sting_description: while looking in the direction of a trap to make it sting a nearby player, only damaging their health and hunger but with significantly more range.
blue.tr.grass_trap_description: Sneak while standing still on a Grass Block to place a trap that'll root and slowly drain the health and hunger of the first player that walks over it.
blue.tr.grass_trap_hover:
Only %s can exist at a time, and they can be destroyed by breaking the block below it
Rooted players can be freed early by breaking the block below them
Equal hitbox to a block, so it can almost be jumped over.
blue.tr.sprout_description: Unless sneaking, planting either Wheat, Potatoes, Carrots, or Beetroots from your mainhand will automatically place more around it.
blue.tr.serenity_description: Nearby mobs will become weakened and silenced.
blue.tr.warden_imitation_description: While in the Deep Dark, gain Speed, Strength, track nearby players that aren't walking, and have a slow heartbeat like a Warden.
blue.tr.armor_ownership_hover:
The first player to wear a fully trimmed set becomes its owner until they lose it or leave the game. This will remove all ownership they already have (OFF, ON)

If you're an operator who wishes to enable this, then due to the potential impact of this semi-experimental setting, you'll need to manually run %s in chat.
blue.tr.objective_description:
Quests are multi-step and ideally difficult actions/goals
 Tasks are very repetitive and equally easy, but guarded by RTD
 Unlock simply requires players to be the first to pickup its template
blue.tr.first_player: Trims Overhaul has a relatively complicated system to using abilities. To change this, go through [server settings] and change %s or %s.
blue.tr.first_player_hover:
Due to optimization, a trim can only be used by 1 player at a time (for now).
If you just want to test trims in a temporary world, run %s
blue.tr.kinetic_deflection_hover:
A small amount of charge is built over-time, further increased in the Deep Dark.
Can knock yourself back a shorter distance while sneaking
blue.tr.gluttony_description: All foods, even poisonous, give additional Saturation. Golden Apples also give short Resistance, while enchanted ones give random positive (gamble) effects
blue.tr.gluttony_hover: Consuming enchanted golden apples within a short period of each other will give less effects, minimum of 1.
blue.tr.tidal_surge_description: Significantly empowered when used high in the air, teleporting you downwards with a much larger radius.
blue.tr.lunge_description: Double-tap sneak to lunge forward; hitting a target will deal true damage and reduce the ability cooldown.
blue.tr.double_strike_description: Axe hits against enemies will spawn an evoker fang behind the target.
blue.tr.isolation_description: Being near a secluded enemy, Mansion, or Outpost will trigger 'Isolation', granting temporary buffs and enhancing all your abilities. Short activation cooldown.
blue.tr.isolation_hover:
%s - Increased range, speed, and damage. Refreshes on axe kills
%s - Double absorption reduced from those sources
%s - Reaches further behind the target
blue.tr.vulnerability_description: Nearby players get 2 less absorption hearts from Golden Apple(s) and Totem of Undyings.
blue.tr.protected_description: Gain immunity to some negative effects while you have Hero of the Village. When the effect expires, it instead goes down one level and adds time.
blue.tr.ballista_description: If you have Hero of the Village, hold sneak with a charged Crossbow in your main hand to charge a powerful, armor-piercing shot at the cost of the effect's duration.
blue.tr.charge_hover: Maximum of +120%% when wearing a full copper set trimmed with the copper material, copper items in both hands, and in Trial Chambers.
blue.tr.charge_hover_old: Maximum of +60%% when wearing a set fully trimmed with the copper material while in Trial Chambers
blue.tr.fear_hover: Fear causes random hallucinations based on amount, such as sounds, forced movement, fake hits, and more. Trusted players lose fear faster but are still affected. Hold an Eye of Ender to check a player's Fear.
blue.tr.disfigure_description: Staring at an Ender Pearl or Eye of Ender destroys it, with different effects based on the thrower
blue.tr.disfigure_hover:
Untrusted players are temporarily cursed, preventing them from throwing additional Ender Pearls
Your own instead erupt into a cloud of mist, inflicting various debuffs and high Fear
 - You can also teleport to it by sneaking
blue.tr.grand_reveal_description: Sneak while standing still to supercharge Reveal, quadrupling its range with guaranteed glowing. Players are slowed, glow longer, and receive low %s.
blue.tr.reveal_description: Randomly give Glowing to anything nearby unless you're using Stalk. Hold sneak to slightly increase range.
blue.tr.egg_bonus_hover: Wearing the Dragon Egg grants an environmental buff for the active trim (ON, OFF)
blue.tr.limit_owned_trims_hover_note: Also prevents them from even progressing objectives if they're at the limit
blue.tr.manual_transferring_hover: Players can use the transfer menu to give away their ownership (ON, OFF)
blue.tr.random_task_defender_hover_note: Only matters if the 'Objective Type' setting is set to 'Tasks'
blue.tr.owner_finder_hover: Wearing a trim without its ownership will have particles appear in the direction of its actual owner if they're online (ON, OFF)
blue.tr.sm.projectile_hover: Rib needs to be in combat to shoot Wither Skulls and Fireballs (ON, OFF)
blue.tr.ashen_origin_description: Nether kills fill a soul meter. Once full, enter Ashen Trance: gain Strength and short max-Resistance, with additional kills extending the duration and summoning a temporary, allied Nether mob (max 8).
blue.tr.ashen_origin_hover:
Includes a stronger scorch effect, independent from Flaming Aegis.
Can be configured by the server to count kills outside the Nether.
blue.tr.fireball_description: %s + %s to shoot out a small fireball. Part of the Wither Skull ability
blue.tr.explorer_1_description: Jump Boost and Speed while sprinting. Immunity to Slowness. When holding maps, spears, or standing on path blocks, get faster the longer you sprint out of combat.
blue.tr.gust_enchant: Unusable enchant in Trims Overhaul - check FAQs (wiki) for more info
blue.tr.please_report: Please report this item in the Trims Overhaul Discord, minor issue
blue.tr.coast_quest_description: Crafting without proper conditions will have no benefit
blue.tr.trust_badge: This entire ability is affected by the trust system. Click for a shortcut
blue.tr.partial_trust_badge: Only parts of this ability is affected by the trust system. Click for a shortcut
blue.tr.combat_badge: This ability is affected by the %s (being hit recently)
blue.tr.adv.vanilla_materials.desc: When worn, they grant small stackable bonuses. A full set grants an additional stack, while synergies double it.
blue.tr.guardian_description: When entering combat, all nearby Iron Golems will target your attacker. Spawns a temporary one if none exist, empowering it inside villages.
blue.tr.sandstorm_description: If you're hit, gain Speed, Invisibility and release a lingering dust cloud that cloaks Ender Pearls.
blue.tr.sandstorm_hover: Trusted players have increased visibility through the sandstorm, and their pearls will be cloaked when thrown through it.
blue.tr.raisure_description: Break sand without a shovel to launch it upward, slowing and damaging on impact based on airtime. Can be deflected by any player punching it.
blue.tr.raisure_hover: Deals additional damage when in sandy biomes, and sneaking reduces launch height.
blue.tr.loyalty_description: to make thrown Tridents instantly stop, returning with Loyalty. The nearest one can also unleash Tidal Burst if you aren't holding another Trident.
blue.tr.fire_hover:
Cod = Basic shot; medium damage and range but no cooldown
Salmon = Fast piercing shot with very high damage to secondary targets
Pufferfish = Semi-random amount of spread out, short-ranged shots
Tropical Fish = Random debuff, low chance for positive - reverse on allies.

Everything except Pufferfish has a 25%% to fire twice.
You can stand still to reduce spread, if any.
Slightly increased range when in shipwrecks.
blue.tr.harpoon_description: Thrown Tridents pull their target toward you, executing them if they're very low on health. Greatly increased throw strength after killing with a thrown Trident.
blue.tr.tutorial.unowned: You aren't the "%s" of the trim you've just equipped, so instead of abilities, you just have access to %s - if enabled. Click this message to open the owner list.
blue.tr.tutorial.unowned_hover:
If you're a server operator and want to test trims, then you have 3 options;
1. Give yourself ownership by running %s
2. Enable the semi-experimental and possibly undesirable %s setting through %s
3. Or the easiest but most dangerous. Only run the following command if this world can be ruined - %s

With all of this in mind, a trim can only be reliably used by 1 player at a time due to them all being optimized. No, it's not possible to change this (yet), that's one of the only things that aren't customizable in this datapack, even if you can tweak some files. Click here to join the Discord if you have any questions
blue.tr.sm.charge_speed_hover: Speed at which Sentry's 'Ballista' charges  •  Default: 5
